channel.title: How Do I change Login place
channel.description:
Hi, I am going to attach 2 pictures to this post. The first picture is where all new players spawn when they log in for the first time. The second picture is where I want them to spawn. Can someone please tell me how to change the spawn point? Thanks.
Pictures are linked with PhotoBucket
pic 1: http://s1339.photobucket.com/user/godexserver/media/login_zps85eea1f4.png.html
pic 2: http://s1339.photobucket.com/user/godexserver/media/login1_zpsc40ceeac.png.html?sort=3&o=0
-- [img]http://s1339.photobucket.com/user/godexserver/media/login_zps85eea1f4.png.html[/img]
[img]http://s1339.photobucket.com/user/godexserver/media/login1_zpsc40ceeac.png.html?sort=3&o=0[/img]

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:13, topic:515835”]Haha no problem man

Also, for your other threads, be more specific. Say you’re using allstar so then people will only give you help for allstar servers.[/quote]

Ok. (:

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Haha no problem man

Also, for your other threads, be more specific. Say you’re using allstar so then people will only give you help for allstar servers.

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

marcbob:

So did you then search 2852 in any of those files…?

Thanks! I just got it!

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

marcbob:

Don’t search client.java everytime. Search the folder that the server is in. Search 2852 and then just look for results that look good.

In the folder that all my files are in, I typed in the Y coords, and all i got was an account file in characters (he was at them pos,)
client.java
player.java
npcs.java
and items.java

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I change Login place

Don’t search client.java everytime. Search the folder that the server is in. Search 2852 and then just look for results that look good.

item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

marcbob:

So then just search the X Coord in the server folder and you should be able to figure it out from there

Alright and I am pretty sure I know which one to do. I just did ::mypos and it says

You are standing on X=2852 Y=3591
You are standing on X=2852 Y=3591 Your height = 0
CurrentX: 52 CurrentY: 55

EDITED BELOW

I just searched for them coords in the client.java and I used ::tele #### #### and none of them coords were to that spawn pos.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

So then just search the X Coord in the server folder and you should be able to figure it out from there

item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:5, topic:515835”][quote author=1 2 3 4 KOED link=topic=634088.msg4281980#msg4281980 date=1365793061]
It’s in Config.java>server sided.
[/quote]

That’s for PI and it looks like he is using allstar.

All you need to do is make yourself admin and then do ::coords or ::mypos, whatever command to get the coords of the spot your at. Do the command at the starting spot and then search the server folder for it.[/quote]

Yes, I am using an AllStar Source. I can easily find the coords by clicking the emote tab, it has them on the top right side, then teleports on the bottom.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

1 2 3 4 KOED:

It’s in Config.java>server sided.

That’s for PI and it looks like he is using allstar.

All you need to do is make yourself admin and then do ::coords or ::mypos, whatever command to get the coords of the spot your at. Do the command at the starting spot and then search the server folder for it.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @GodexCAB GodexCAB
item.description:
@GodexCAB wrote:

[quote=“deadlyhorror, post:2, topic:515835”]I am more accustomed to 562’s but try config.java

Look for “START_LOCATION”:

Ex:

public static final int START_LOCATION_X = 2956; // start here public static final int START_LOCATION_Y = 3218;

If this doesn’t work just search for the starting coords in the source search box :P[/quote]

I can’t find config.java and I even searched for it in my server files. When I open client.java and search for the coords I find posX but not posY.

Read full topic
item.source: How Do I change Login place

item.title: How Do I change Login place
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

I am more accustomed to 562’s but try config.java

Look for “START_LOCATION”:

Ex:

public static final int START_LOCATION_X = 2956; // start here public static final int START_LOCATION_Y = 3218;

If this doesn’t work just search for the starting coords in the source search box

Read full topic
